alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Des Moines; Henry; Lee; Louisa; Muscatine; Scott; Van Buren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 20 at 10:15PM CST until December 24 at 6:00AM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. Blizzard conditions will also be possible, with extremely cold wind chills as well. Wind chills as low as 30 to 40 below will be possible, especially starting midday Thursday. * WHERE...Portions of north central, northwest and west central Illinois, east central and southeast Iowa and northeast Missouri. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on dangerous road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches, leading to power outages. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Uncertainty remains on snowfall totals, but impacts from the combined effects of the wind and snow are expected. Thus, blizzard conditions will be possible. This will also lead to difficulty when gathering accurate measurements of snow during the event. This will be a long duration event, so plan appropriately prior to the start. Plan holiday travel around peak hours of the storm, either before or after impacts.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Clinton; Des Moines; Henry; Lee; Louisa; Muscatine; Scott; Van Buren
